Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it says”
Reviews.Author: themit
Reviews.Content: I arrived on my flight at 9:45pm and was set to leave at 7:10am, so booked the transit hotel. I tried Terminal 2 and 3 but these were fully booked. On arrival, check-in was a bit disorganised as they struggled to find a room (despite it being booked some time ago). I needed the room for 8 hours (10pm-6am) and was given to 2 hours free to make up for the noise due to rennovations. The noise wasn't bad, the room was spacious and comfortable- except lacking in external windows. The wake-up call was on-time and checkout was a breeze. It was very close to the Skytrain to Terminal 2, so I was able to head to the Business Class lounge for my flight to enjoy a nightcap, then breakfast. Clean, spacious, comfortable and reasonably streamlined- I will be staying here again because it does exactly what it says.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what it is”
Reviews.Author: hiflya
Reviews.Content: I had a fight getting into Singapore at 1:00am Instead of heading into the city and paying for another night at my hotel, I decided to stay to stay here for about $60 US for 6 hours. Then went into the city and was allowed an early check-in at about 9:00 am. I was able to get 5 hours of well needed sleep and started my day off great. It's a basic transit hotel with a decent size room and good bed. It's also just upstairs from the immigration desk so moving on was very easy in the morning. There have been comments about construction noise, I didn't notice any and I'm sure that whatever their may be will be short term and infrequent.

Reviews.Title: “Changi terminal one transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bubbles46Poole
Reviews.Content: We found ourselves with 13 hours to spare en route from Sydney to London.I decided to book a room at the transit hotel . I had read several bad reviews about the Terminal 1 transit hotel so I tried to book at 2 or3 . These were fully booked so we accepted a booking at the terminal 1 hotel. It certainly did not disappoint .We had an excellent room,completely brand new refurbished,right down to the new large flat screened TV.There was no window which we didn't mind ,and it was completely silent ,ideal for a decent sleep.Toiletries and fresh soft towels were provided ,as well as tea and coffee making facilities, and the room was spotlessly clean. We booked a block of six hours but on reflection we should have booked for longer. We will definitely book at the terminal one transit hotel again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great night”
Reviews.Author: Lou_and_Paul
Reviews.Content: We live in Darwin and all international flights out of Darwin arrive in SIN at 10pm, with all connecting flights to SEA leaving the next morning so with two kids, and Nana in tow this hotel is great. We get off our flight, book in, sleep, shower and then off to the Qantas Club for breakfast in the morning. A previous reviewer has said about a problem with their booking (through a travel agent), we always book ourselves and therefore don't have others mistakes to rely on. The room is incredibly dark so you would be able to get a sleep even in the day time. I understand that there are some upgrades going on, our room certainly seemed more updated than that of pictures posted by other reviewers, but unfortunately I didn't get any photos. As we fly with Jetstar (low cost carrier) we can't get our luggage transferred to our next flight. WE leave our luggage on the carosel and pick it up in the morning after going through Immigration. Yes this sounds a bit dodgy but this is how it is advertised to be done on the Changi Airport website and we have never had any problems.

Reviews.Title: “"Close your eyes and try to sleep"”
Reviews.Author: kocour324
Reviews.Content: I tried this opportunity to stay in transit hotel T1 for the first time and to be honest, I will never do it again. It just fulfill the need to have a break with sleep (if you can sleep) for a block of 6 hours with extention. The room appears like jail having no windows! The interior is outdated, very simple and cleanliness may cry for improvement. Next time I will rather take whisky and a nap in the lounge!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Bilip
Reviews.Content: I recommend this facility if only spending a transit visit to Singapore.For blocks of 6 hours I always find it so good...have a shower,a comfortable and quiet bedroom,have a coffee and emerge refreshed for the next leg of the flight.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but adequate for the purpose”
Reviews.Author: BenDaniels
Reviews.Content: A basic hotel inside the airport terminal. No frills but that is to be expected as you book on 6 hour blocks. Bed is comfortable, clean towels etc but expect no fancy things and there is no wifi in the room or hotel - use the airport free wifi when back in terminal Location is near gate D40 in Terminal 1 Was rested and clean after the stay and that is the key thing as I had a 12 hour stopover and it was a welcome place to sleep and shower

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: Bobmk1
Reviews.Content: Basic ok place to grab some shut eye. Not the cleanest place....but fine

Reviews.Title: “Really pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: BWFC82
Reviews.Content: On two occasions recently we found ourselves with about 5 hours wait for long international flights from Singapore hub, and booked in to this transit hotel. It is excellent value - very quiet, very clean, and with very helpful and efficient check in staff. You book in 6 hour blocks of time - which for us worked out at £39 - excellent value, as it also includes access to the roof top swimming pool and bar, which is a real plus when between flights. So we had a swim, a drink and about 3 hours restful sleep, which worked out about the same price as an airport vip lounge!

Reviews.Title: “Six hours of relief”
Reviews.Author: Gadman
Reviews.Content: My first exposure to Asian airport transit hotels was in Taipei, and I try to use them throughout SE Asia whenever I am on long hauls. By the time I hit Changi after flying for 18 hours, I was ready to sleep under a restaurant table! I took a six hour minimum block at the Ambassador Transit hotel, slept for five, had a shower, watched some CNN and the plane jockey around outside and then left for my next connection. Room was clean and basic, they provide toiletries if yours were in transit with your checked baggage, and it was quiet like a tomb. Perfect for the target market. I was a happy customer.

Reviews.Title: “re check your booking”
Reviews.Author: davnicarr
Reviews.Content: we flew from amsterdam to Singapore , travel agent had booked and we had given bankcard number as per normal to secure booking, Travel Agent was told as soon as we landed we could acsess room, they are sold in 6 hour lots. We arrived tired broken leg etc , looking forward to a rest, NO NO !! you have to wait 3 hours to get into room , we quietly spoke to girls behind counter, we have booked paid etc, NO the result was we had to wait 3 hours. The girls need an attitude adjustment. the room when we finally got in were really good big bathroom , wheel chair friendly. Yes that was booked too. so please be carefull you check it out thoroughly. We have also warned our Travel Agent

Reviews.Title: “A must for long haul travellers in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: xlaurzx
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the transit hotel terminal 1 as the ones in terminal 3 and 2 were fully booked so we had to make our way to this one. A must stay for anyone with a 7+ transit stay in the airport. We had a long 13 hour wait and so booked in for 6 hours and then did the free Singapore bus which was great. Would stay here again when travelling back to the UK and will reccommend to others to do it as well!

Reviews.Title: “A secret heaven for transit passengers”
Reviews.Author: DandMtravel
Reviews.Content: forget trawling around shops where youll never buy anything, have a swim and snooze here between flights. fab.

Reviews.Title: “So convenient!”
Reviews.Author: beentheredonethatTT
Reviews.Content: Fantastic value and the best way to arrive at your destination refreshed and relaxed. Only complaint was the carpet could have done with cleaning!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant for a much needed sleep!”
Reviews.Author: snownoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 hours in a nicely furnished, dark and quiet room - just what you want in the middle of two long haul flights. The room had a huge double/king type bed and clean bathroom with an awesome shower (hot water did run out though). There was no window which for us was great as we just wanted a sleep. There was a TV if jet lag was keeping you awake. It was generally very quiet - we did hear the occasional flight announcement but it was barely audible and not the kind of noise to wake you from your sleep. It is right next to the swimming pool which you can use during the time that you have booked the room by presenting your room key. This is a fab idea and makes super long haul travel pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than What Was Expected”
Reviews.Author: Amy W
Reviews.Content: Our flight arrived in Singapore at 10pm, our flight out was 11am. This was the perfect option for us and we could only stay here because we had our bags checked through on to our next flight. If you clear customs unfortunately you can't stay here as you will have passed through security. The rooms are much better than I expected from the photo's on the website. Everything was easy, check-in, drop bags, sleep, shower, leave. No negative points for this place, would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “There’s a plane parked outside my bedroom window!”
Reviews.Author: SydneyKate_40
Reviews.Content: We stayed in T1 (Terminal 1) for 1 night in transit from Siem Reap. I was told not to expect much but was pleasantly surprised by a massive room that could accommodate 5 (there was 4 of us). The best part was the floor to ceiling windows overlooking Changi tarmac, we literally had planes parked right outside our hotel room, this was a huge novelty to us all especially for my two kids. As soon as we woke the next morning they couldn’t wait to see if any more planes had parked outside their ‘bedroom window’. The rooms are not luxurious but the hotel is not intended as a luxury hotel but a “transit” hotel (hence the name). The shower did not have a floor separator in the bathroom so the floor was drenched and a bit slippery, otherwise it was fine. I believe you need to book a standard room if you want a private bathroom. I also thought the price was reasonable. There is no room service but you can literally walk into the airport terminal and grab a bite to eat / drink or shop if you haven’t already done enough. Many of the eateries do start to shutdown after 10pm in T1 but you should find something basic. There is also a pool in T1 that guests can use (we didn’t due to time). A very good option of you are in transit for a few hours or overnight. You don’t even have to clear customs, you literally walk off the plane and into your hotel, there is a Transit hotel in each terminal so you can choose based upon which terminal you are flying in and out of or which hotel/airport amenities you wish to be near. Even if you are flying in/out of a different terminals it is only a quick Skytrain ride between terminals. Tip! As you do not clear customs in Changi remember to pack your PJ’s, toiletries, medications, change of clothes etc in your carry-on bag as your larger luggage will be checked through to your next destination. The Crowne Plaza is much nicer but it also more expensive. However the Ambassador Transit provided a very clean, comfortable & convenient place to stay whilst in transit.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to crash at Changhi Airport”
Reviews.Author: Bill R
Reviews.Content: The transit hotel in T1 at Changhi Airport is clean,functional and good value for money and is a very good place to crash for a few hours in between flight connections. The only downside is you overlook the taxiway and can hear aircraft landing and taking off.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills or Bells & Whistles, but most convenient for long transits”
Reviews.Author: hotelanatomist
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Terminal 1 Transit Hotel at Changi Airport for a minimum block of 6 hours with my family in a triple room. The room was small, very basic, small single beds x 3, sparse furniture and am ensuite bathroom. No bells or whistles, but the room was quite clean and the staff attentive, polite and efficient. I had asked for a room in Terminal 3 with the hope that it being the newest terminal, the rooms would be nicer. However, from the sounds of it, all hotels at the three terminals operated a very busy schedule and I guess, in the end, we were fortunate to get a reservation confirmed. Mind you, I made my request for reservation almost 7 weeks in advance! Travellers may also be aware that Changi Airport, arguably among the best in the world, does offer lots for the transit passenger. In the end, we used the hotel room just for the shower on arrival and pre-departure. Separate shower facilities are also offered at the airport. Overall, adequate, nothing fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Great transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: soetantoa
Reviews.Content: Excellent transit hotel too bad there isn't wifi connection, you'll need to go to terminal floor. Other than that its perfect place for long transit.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal!”
Reviews.Author: NW28
Reviews.Content: After a late departure by Jetstar from Melbourne airport, we missed our connecting flight. Jetstar did not provide any assistance in this instance, so we collected our bags and checked into the next flight (which left the next day) leaving us with 11 or so hours and no luggage. We ended up seeking assistance from the Information Counter at Changi Airport who could not have been more helpful. They confirmed that the Transit Hotels in terminals 2 and 3 were full, and there was room in Terminal 1 but that renovations were underway and it was likely to be noisy. We apprehensively checked in and were pleasantly surprised to find a newish, very clean room which was reasonably spacious for what it was. We headed straight back out to purchase the supplies that we forgot to pack in our hand luggage (eg toothpaste) although I believe limited supplies are available from reception on request. After a tasty dinner in the terminal, we came back and had a relaxing shower before settling into bed and watching some tv on the flat screen tv. The bed was large and comfortable and we did not hear one whisper of noise all night. There is also a pool and a gym located nearby if this is of interest to you. This hotel was ideal for our purpose and I would not hesitate to recommend, or use again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & serves a purpose”
Reviews.Author: ryben01
Reviews.Content: We had booked 2 rooms for our family of 4 for a 7hr stay arriving at 10pm. Checkin was a bit of a shock!!! after providing details and payment I was told that the smoke alarms would be tested at 4am yes 4am and that at the same time the a/c would be turned off for 2 hours!!! NICE I mean the reason for staying here is to catch some shut eye while waiting for next flight, I realize that these things have to be tested but at 4am?? WTF. There was no confusion on their part how I felt about this and was furious that they had waited to tell me after I had paid. All of a sudden English was not proficient!!! Got into the rooms and as I had stayed here before they were the same, was not particularly impressed with the cleanliness of the bathroom in 1 of the rooms as there was hair on the floor and it was not ours! The bedspread was also stained with what looked like coffee, we didnt use it anyway as room was stuffy and a/c was cranked up ready for their stupid shutdown! I doubt whether my outburst had any effect but others were also complaining on checkin over there intended antics at 4am but they did NOT occur, whether they realized how stupid it was or had made a mistake who knows lol But we were happy none the less lol Check out was easy as was locating the suitcases from previous nights flights. All in all this hotel is a convenient option for transit and nothing else, however for the price one pays service needs to improve!!!

Reviews.Title: “By need , not choice.”
Reviews.Author: Eddie and Judi P
Reviews.Content: I was our first experience at a transit hotel and where left somewhat disappointed.The reception staff had a very poor attitude they where not welcoming and had an air of "take it or leave it " The rooms where very basic but in saying that I do acknowledge that this is only a room to rest or sleep between flights.We will stay here again by need not by choice. Reception staff need training on how to be more welcoming . A tired traveller appreciates friendly helpful staff and would not care how basic a room is when they are only on transit.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and essential”
Reviews.Author: nic r
Reviews.Content: Why did no-one tell me about these hotels before?? The hysterical, sleep-deprived 3 year old can get some down-time, a bath and a rest, and the parents can have a break in a room that is clean, quiet and no-fuss. Anyone travelling with kids who has a long layover in Singapore should do this.

Reviews.Title: “things to be aware of”
Reviews.Author: tommaynz
Reviews.Content: The airport hotel is on the transit side of immigration - do not go out through immigration control if you are staying at this hotel. We had a 14hour stopover so our luggage could not be booked through to next destination, so we had to go through to pick it up -hence we could not get back in to stay in hotel. After hours wasted haggling and pleading we were allowed to check our bags back in and get through. I would suggest the Crown hotel adjacent to airport (access via walkway) if you want to have a look around Singapore city. The airport is fantastic -plenty to keep you occupied for hours, comfortable and good priced food. The train leaves from airport and gets you to Marina Bay area in 20 min for about$2.It is easy to use and the system is now expanded and connections are easy. What a wonderful city, well worth a long look.

Reviews.Title: “More than I could have expected and perfect for this picky high maintenance traveler”
Reviews.Author: EpicureanFunTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to Singapore for pleasure numerous times over the years and this time my transit time was limited. I arrived at SIN late (around 2 am) after flying Delta Business Class from Tokyo. I was going to fly from SIN to Bali the next day, but had yet purchased a ticket. I saw the transit hotel and decided to see if they had a room. They did. I expected little. I was surprised when I went to my room. I have stayed in numerous expensive, crummy, dirty airport hotels (see my review of Crown Plaza LAX) that my expectations were low. The room was basic and rented to me for 6 hours. What a perfect concept for a traveler in transit. I had two single beds, a desk, clean floor, clean bathroom and darkness. In the morning I learned that my room had a delightful view of the airport. How fun for the little kid in me. The staff was kind and efficient checking me in. It saved me money not having to take a taxi to town, get a full priced room, and take a taxi back to the airport in the morning. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient when in transit”
Reviews.Author: Blossom55
Reviews.Content: This pay by the hour transit hotel is a clean convenient solution to a lengthy layover between planes at Changing airport. It is a no- frills solution, but wl serviced, clean & very convenient. It is as efficient as Singspore rightfully prides itself to be.

Reviews.Title: “Totally necessary!”
Reviews.Author: naybe
Reviews.Content: This hotel for me, like I say, was totally necessary. I couldn't imagine myself wandering an airport for 6 hours after being on a 7 hour flight and knowing I had another 18 hours of travel still ahead of me. Its is perfect for a transit hotel. Easy access, no fuss, just basic accommodation for your basic needs - sleep and shower! I went for the private room with bathroom because I knew I wanted to have some "me" time after being squished in with strangers on a plane for so long. For what works out to be about $10 per hour it was totally worth it! Unfortunately I was located across from some sort of cleaning cupboard so there was a bit of noise but nothing I couldn't sleep through. There were no windows so it really allows for you to relax and unwind in total privacy. This is budget accommodation so don't expect room service or anything, just a clean and comfortable space. This will be a must for my next stop over in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a late night arrival and early departure”
Reviews.Author: LsBob
Reviews.Content: The Transit Hotel is a convenient place to stay if you have a few hours between flights. We arrived at 10.30pm and as out next flight was not until 10.00am it allowed us a convenient place to sleep. It gave us an extra 2 hours sleep if you took into account the travelling time and finding some where to eat if we had gone to a hotel. And it was cheaper. It was also one of the few hotels that offered 3 beds which was a plus. The room was clean, nothing flash but if you only want some where to sleep and have a shower before moving on, it meets those needs. Currently there were notices up about work being carried out in the airport but we didn't hear it while in our rooms. The minimum booking time is 6 hours but you can stay longer, just pay for the extra hours which is handy if your flights are odd times. Check-in and out was quick and downstairs in the Transit area were the various eating places. The next morning we collected our luggage from the Luggage area by the carousels and passed through Customs and Immigration.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing stop between flights!”
Reviews.Author: JOHGRAKER
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoyed the pitstop at this hotel on our flight from Cape Town to Seoul. My daughter especially enjoyed the complementary swim at the pool which was just what we needed to refresh! After the 1-2 hour swim we took a shower and slept for 4 hours, because we did not have to rush through traffic being at the airport. The staff gave us a wake-up call an hour before departure and we found them to be great!

Reviews.Title: “Above-average transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: taliabo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was neat and clean (although I agree with others that this one is the least updated of the three major Changi terminals) but it is convenient to Skytrain connecting to all terminals. A coffee maker, HDTV are part of the limited amenities...but when you are in one of the world's best-equipped and serviced airports, you can get just about anything you want. I was disappointed they didn't have power adaptors, and the free Changi Airport-wide WiFi ran poorly in this corner spot, but everything else was fine. Starbucks is downstairs, which is nice. I wasn't disturbed by on-going renovation of Terminal 1 Darryl (Aug 12, 2011)

Reviews.Title: “For a quick snooze”
Reviews.Author: mdns
Reviews.Content: Out of the 3 Transit Hotels inside the airport, this is still the least updated. The look is kind of old, but I see that they're working on upgrading of all transit hotels inside.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: yfuwong
Reviews.Content: I was worry about staying in terminal 1 transit hotel at first as i heard about the renovation work and potential noise. But since i arrived Singapore 11pm and my next flight via Delta is 6am, this is the best hotel to get to avoid the custom clearance. At first i only manage to book the hotel with budget room (without bathroom), but then when i arrived they have normal room and so i take the normal one (S$68). The hotel is easily located as it is near gate 40 as described in the booking note. Check-in is fast and they gave me a key with key-chain made of wood. I have trouble opening the door and the receptionist was kind enough to show me the technique to open it and she admit that open the door there could be a challenge. Once into the room, i was impressed by the interior look, it looks very new, modern and clean, even it is small. The bathroom is clean and i enjoyed the shower. The bed is comfortable and flat screen tv has lots of channels, but i am too tired to watch them. I had a good sleep before waken up by the morning call and get prepared for my next flight.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet comfortable rooms at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Lionel41
Reviews.Content: If you have more than 4 hours in transit this is the best place to go for a freshen up and a sleep before continuing your journey. There is a wake up service so you don't miss your next flight. Room are comfortable, have tea and coffee making facilities and TV. Despite renovation work in progress while we were there we have a quite and comfortable rest. We would definately use this facility again. You don't have to clear immigration or customs and you have everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel room at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Ert53
Reviews.Content: This was a good basic hotel room although I agree with one reviewer that the bed was a little on the hard side. Singapore beds all seem to be like that. There was no clock (!) (these seem to be increasingly rare in hotels, especially, for some reason, in airport hotels) and we also noted that although very basic toiletries were provided there was no disposable razor, which is a bit of an oversight. As I had read some Trip Advisor reviews that reported that most rooms did not have windows, I specifically requested a room with a window, as I am claustrophobic. I was contacted personally by email and the request was fulfilled. However the 'window' actually overlooks an internal airport corridor ,and although there are windows beyond that to the outside, if you were really claustrophobic this might not be acceptable. There was free internet access. The price was very reasonable, and no complaints really. You can get an English style breakfast at an Indian restaurant very nearby in the terminal (can't remember the name, unfortunately; it was upstairs).

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Adz71
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night in transit in Dec 2009. Hotel was very clean and comfortable, staff were very efficient, from internet booking through to check out. Made it easy to catch up on a few hours of lost sleep

Reviews.Title: “The best way to spend time in-between long flights”
Reviews.Author: levi2225
Reviews.Content: If traveling in different hemispheres (like UK to Australia), chances are your stopovers will be in an Asian country, either Singapore and Hong Kong, and if you travel economy you know you won't rest as good as those in business/first class. This hotel is a good way for travelers to have a good restful break from their travels but only if you have a lay over time of 6 hours or more, otherwise the cost is not justifiable and just pay the $8.00 Singapore dollar shower available at the hotel and then laze around the various departure lounges. Also, as previous posters have mentioned, you cannot check into this airport unless you have checked in to your flight and go through immigration yourself. However there are ways to go through around this rule. What we did on our 12 hour lay over on our return flight to Auckland was to pass through Immigration and retrieve our luggage. On the arrivals section of Terminal 1 we took the walkalator down to basement level 2 and deposited our 5 pieces of luggage on the Left Baggage section. It costs around 25 Singaporean dollars for our 5 pieces of luggage and the fee is for a 24 hour deposit. It will cost more if you have luggage of unusual shapes (surfboards and the like). Took the cab to the CBD and for the first 5 hours of our lay over we made some last minute sightseeing (as malls open at 11 am), then shopping and lunch. We took the cab again to the airport and luckily JetStar had an early check in counter so we were able to retrieve our baggage from the Left Baggage, checked them in, pass through immigration, then checked into the hotel. It took quite a bit of time to check in since we did not have reservation and there were construction works going on but you will appreciate the fact that for 4 to 5 hours you a lying down on a bed with pillows. With the Chilean volcanic ash cancelling flights to and from Australia or New Zealand, the departure section was quite full so we thought of trying our luck with the hotel so that we can have some bit of rest and charge our phones, laptop and tablet in relative comfort and security. Rooms are booked by 6 hour blocks and they will insist on giving you a wake up call 2 to 1.5 hours before boarding time to give you time to wake up and have a shower. Yes, the rooms are nothing fancy but all you need is a bed and some pillows to catch some zzzzzzz before you take your next flight. We had a good 4 hour snooze before the concierge made the wake up call. The bath has a tandem shower/bath, with clean towels, shampoo/conditioner dispenser and the usual accoutrements but surprisingly, no toothbrush and toothpaste (you have to call room service for them, and they are complimentary). Be sure to have a change of clothes in your carry on luggage. It cost us around 76 Singaporean dollars but to us it was worth it as we clean and restful enough to endure another overnight flight.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel if you have a long stopover between flights.”
Reviews.Author: hippodreams
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel when we had a nine hour stopover inbetween our flights. The hotel is perfectly located within the airport so you don't have to spend time going through immigration when you just want somewhere to rest for a few hours. We did not have a booking (as we had mistakenly been booked into an airport hotel outside the immediate airport), but the staff were able to accommodate us and immediately checked us into a room. As we only needed a short stay, we booked in for a six hour time slot with a wake up call booked for just before the end of the booking time. We were very tired after a long flight and were grateful for this. We paid about $70 (Singapore dollars) and thought this was reasonable. The rooms and bathrooms are basic but very clean, which was all we needed. We slept well for several hours and then had a meal at one of the restaurants before catching a 1 am flight. I have kept the contact details for the hotel as we will use them again for future stopovers, and I plan to pass on their details to our travel agent also.

Reviews.Title: “EXACTLY what you need and so easy”
Reviews.Author: jazvrx
Reviews.Content: I did a flight from Sydney - Cairo with a 20 hour stop over in Singapore. I stayed in the Transit hotel and it was soo perfect, its nothing spectacular but when you start to get all restless during a flight and want to just stretch out and rest or even have a nice shower this is perfect. It has a TV, bathroom/toilet, tea and coffee making fascilities it was very easy to find and well worth every penny. I really like singapore airport, i was well entertained while i had my stop over (took the train across to the next terminal so i felt like i was doing sight seeing without leaving the airport) There is a gym in the airport, good to get the blood flowing again, playstation / xbox area, even a beautician its a little city! I actually try and get a longer waiting time in singapore now just so i can have a shower and wander around and prepare for next leg, you can buy the hotel in blocks of hours too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place between flights (when no upgrading works are going on)”
Reviews.Author: Gwaladar
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed at this place was in November 2009 and since I was very satisfied, I used again this hotel during a night stopover in Singapore last Februrary. Unfortunately -although I was well aware of it- the airport Terminal One -where my room was- was undergoing upgrading works throughout day and night (this should still last till mid 2011), so it was not that easy to sleep (fortunately the staff at the reception offered me some earplugs, because although the noise was not continuous, it kept on disturbing from time to time). So I believe that as soon as upgrading works end, the sleep quality will be again as good as it was the first time I stayed here. In any case I consider this hotel a great option when stoping over in Singapore for several hours. Rooms are clean, spacious, pretty modern and well equipped (they have air-conditioning but no windows). Staff at the reception is nice, efficent and helpful. In front of the reception, by the way, the hotel has a swimming pool which I really hope to enjoy one day if I don't forget again my swimming trunks. With regards to places to eat, you can find good places in Terminal One as well as free internet terminals. Actually Changi Airport Terminal One is almost like a city where it seems that it is possible to satisfy almost all your needs. Something I also like to stress is that the hotel will not ask for your credit card details when making a booking. They just tell you that they will keep your room during 1 hour after your flight lands, so you have enough time to show up and register. Finally, remember not to clear immigration/customs when arriving because the hotel is situated within the transit area. So if you must fly with another company after your stay at the hotel, clear immigration/customs only after your stay and then go to the "Lost & Found" counter to pick up your luggage (if your connecting flight is operated by the same company, they will probably just put your luggage in your next plane and, in this case, you won't need to clear immigration/customs. Nevertheless ask your company before arriving in Singapore).

Reviews.Title: “Be in bed in 20 minutes”
Reviews.Author: ppilot
Reviews.Content: Arriving at 0045 from the U.S. we had reservations at the Ambassador Transit Hotel, actually there are three, one in each terminal. We were in our Spartan room 25 minutes after arrival. Note: you do not clear customs or immigration, and you must be carry-on with your luggage or it ends up on the carousel outside and you cannot get it and come back in. On-line reservations are recommended because the hotels can fill up. You can get from Terminal to Terminal easily either by tram or moving sidewalks so it does not matter which gate you arrive. You rent your room in 6 hour blocks of time. We were in the Terminal 2 Hotel and it was quite tired and shabby, 19” box style TV with a lousy picture, no wi-fi in rooms although there is free wi-fi and internet computers throughout the airport but all the hotels are being renovated. No room service, no mini bar, no washcloths, and no window (in our room anyway) but controllable air-conditioning, one pillow per bed and kleenex. Many food and drink options in the Terminals, This seems preferable to renting a room downtown that you don’t use until 2AM.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: cecilred
Reviews.Content: Worst part of a month in Southeast Asia! They should not even be allowed to rent these rooms. The construction noise makes sleep impossble. Do not waste your money if you want more then a shower for $76

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: oldglossopian
Reviews.Content: Stopped here on 10 hour stopover on Singapore. Hotel is as described, a comfortable transit hotel with clean basic rooms, comfortable beds and extremely convenient as it is airside. If you're transiting through Singapore and don't want to cleat customs them this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “horrible short term stay - waste of money”
Reviews.Author: asiacali
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in the transit hotel in T3 last year(and had a positive experience), we knew what to expect and just wanted to catch a few hours sleep and a quick shower inbetween one 6 hour trip and the upcoming 20 hour one. What a mistake! This was a terrible stopover; no sleep - sounds of jackhammers and construction adjacent, peeping workers in the window (mind you this is high off the ground) and had to change rooms due to leakage. TV didn't even work well enough to drown out or give background noise. They should not be charging the same rates for such an inferior quality of room during this construction activity. I looked with envy at the transit passengers on their reclining chairs in the FREE open terminal area...if we are ever in T1 again, that is where we will be if we find ourselves in the same situation.

Reviews.Title: “if you like the sound of concrete drilling this is the place for you”
Reviews.Author: Travelling-wilbur
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family on 9th of Jan 2011 to pick up an early flight to cambodia the following morning. After checking in at 9 pm we were awoken by loud concrete drilling directly over our heads at 1 am. We moved to another room and the same thing happened on and off from 2am to 4am when we left for our flight check in. The hotel management apologised and to their credit gave us a refund. They said that "some people can sleep through the noise". That may be so - we had just spent 6 weeks in cheap hotels in India and had no problem with the noise levels there so do not consider ourselves to be overly sensitive. It turns out that most of the work on redeveloping terminal one is done at night to avoid daytime disruption. Also there is little communication between the construction team and the hotel and the noise probably varies from night to night. I guess the needs of many thousands of daytime travellers outweight those of a few folks staying at the T1 transit hotel - and that is fair enough. At the end of the day (or night) if you want some assurance of a restful night you might be better off at the Ambassador Hotel in T3, as the receptionist at the T1 hotel put it to me.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a break in between flights”
Reviews.Author: Bibster2005
Reviews.Content: If you need a good sleep and freshen up yourself before reboarding, this is a great place to stay. Basic, nice, clean and comfortable. Close to aerotrain to T2 and shops. There was some renovation noises during our stay but didn't bother us! We paid $118 of a family of 4 (2a/2c) with a block of 6 hours, so it's quite good compared to Crown Plaza!! I would definitely use them again but will try other terminal to see the difference!

Reviews.Title: “No more no less”
Reviews.Author: rockbass2006
Reviews.Content: No frills. Bring some earplugs just in case. I would stay here again - no need for anything better if your passing through. There's actually a pool connected to this hotel - for a fee you can use it. Remember that if you are not clearing customs you will need to pack your toiletries in your carry-on.

Reviews.Title: “What a great idea!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August en route to Paris and then again on the way back to Sydney in October. What a great idea. You book your bags straight through, don't have to clear customs and all that hassle and simply go straight to your room. The rooms are clean and comfortable and spacious. You get use of the gym and pool (if you wish) and travel to any of the other terminals is only a short trip away in the sky train. If you are in transit for more than a couple of hours and don't want to sit around in the lounge, stay here. It was great to catch 4 /5 hours sleep in an actual bed before the next leg of our trip. Because we used Qantas on the Sydney Singapore legs and Singapore Airlines on the Singapore Paris legs we were able to compare the business lounges of each airline. The Singapore lounge was the ultimate. Numerous varieties of hot foods were available at all times and the lounges and seating were beyond reproach. The Qantas lounge on the other hand was the absolute pits. When we arrived the only food available was a sandwich and biscuits and we had to hunt around to find the attendant to serve it. He promised that there would be more food "in about an hour" and he was right. More ordinary sandwiches....what an indightment of Qantas who are obviously on a major cost cutting exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome break on long haul flights”
Reviews.Author: 5gomad
Reviews.Content: Even though there was construction around it was blissfully quiet in the room and we were so grateful to have a good sleep. A cot was delievered quickly and the room was tidy with a good strong shower. Decor a bit dated and I would check out the terminal one branch next time. Also be sure to bring your swimming togs if you have a bit of time because the open air pool is a great way to unwind between flights.

Reviews.Title: “Oldest of the transit hotels at Changi”
Reviews.Author: sirdaav
Reviews.Content: Not my first choice as T3 is so new and quite fancy. Same rate. Terminal 1 is currently being redeveloped, so it's drilling and jack hammering..... you can't hear too too much from the room. T2 and T3 are not that far to walk, if real late the terminal trains stop, so you have no option but to walk around. There is free internet in the terminals, wireless included, does not work from the hotel though. This hotel is spotlessly clean, though not new. It's good, everything works and the wake up calls get you out of there on time, never fails..

Reviews.Title: “Would be good for a rest, but beware construction schedule!”
Reviews.Author: jennythomas74
Reviews.Content: The Ambassador Transit Hotel is ideal for spending a few hours to stretch out and sleep between planes at the Changi Airport. The room is small yet sufficient. It was cleaned satisfactorily. Our room had two beds, which were much more comfortable than a coach airplane seat, and a bathroom with tub/shower, sink and toilet. Just what we needed for 6 hours. However, we were warned at check in about ongoing construction in the airport terminal. This construction goes on at all hours of the day (we head it from 12 a.m. to 6 a.m.). This greatly hindered our ability to get any rest. It was by no means at fault of the Hotel, but is of concern if you are booking a stay in Terminal 1. I suggest that you do some investigation prior to booking. Should my travels bring me back to Changi Airport, I would stay in the Ambassador Hotel again, but would make sure to book in a terminal without construction.

Reviews.Title: “great for a quick rest!”
Reviews.Author: voito
Reviews.Content: The Ambassador Transit Hotel is a great place to get refreshed on the way to somewhere else, or for a brief stopover in Singapore where you want to stay based in the airport. I reserved a budget room for a 6 hour layover between a 1 am arrival and 7 am departure after about 20 hrs transit from the USA. I had been disappointed that the "standard" (i.e. with shower and bathroom) rooms were fully booked, but at 1 am in the morning the shared bathroom/shower rooms were completely empty. If you're not hung up on complete privacy I would say the budget room suffices well, since the shower and toilet rooms are individual and private anyway - you just have to share with others who might be in line to use one. The room was clean, but tiny, without windows, and had that stale motel air conditioner smell, but frankly after 20 hrs on the road at 1am all that mattered was getting cleaned up and having a brief rest. This it accomplished quite well. There is a workout center and pool as well, but neither were open at that time so I didn't investigate. The hotel itself is in a great location directly above arrival gate (D40), so for me it was simply a matter of walking off the jetway, hanging a right up the escalator and checking in. Reminder - if you have to recheck your bag in Singapore, do not go through customs and collect your baggage if it's late at night or early morning, as the check in counter may not be available. Instead, collect your bag from lost and found in the morning and proceed through as usual. Don't worry, it'll be there! Changi Airport makes everything seem so simple and hassle-free, it almost makes you feel like something's wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Firmly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ValanTone
Reviews.Content: We found this a gem. All worked very smoothly, and we thought it good value for a real hotel within an airport. The quietness and darkness of the room were extremely welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, quiet, efficient”
Reviews.Author: MP3Seattle
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here. Room was large, spotless and quiet, even though construction in Terminal One is still going on. Wished I brought my swimsuit as the room included free use of the warm pool and jacuzzi on the rooftop. Also free gym. Simple process: book online a few weeks early, once you land, go straight to the hotel check-in, I flew out 6am and they made me check out at 4am to then go to the Transit desk to get my boarding pass and have the airline put my suitcase (which was held by them) on my departing flight. So, you don't go through immigration and customs lines, don't need to pick up and check in your suitcase. Just bring stuff for overnight (hotel supplies shampoo, soap, hairdrying, plus other amenities if you request them). This gave me several extra hours of sleep. And there's tons of stuff to do at this airport -- even free internet, free movies, gardens to walk through. A train within the transit areas quickly gets you to the other Terminals so you can easily go exploring. Terminal 3 is the best place to hang out.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation don't mean anything.”
Reviews.Author: WORAD
Reviews.Content: I had a confirmed reservation with this hotel which did not seem to mean much. When I went to checkin I was told there were no rooms available. Spent the next 10 hours in the transit area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place for a quick nap”
Reviews.Author: Lifeagain
Reviews.Content: Excellent place for a quick nap and shower in between flights.Comfortable room and bathroom.Had an airside room,so was quite an experience of spending a night in a hotel surrounded by aircrafts instead of cars:)In room coffee maker was available and adequate sachets of tea,coffee and sugar. A definite recco place for travellers looking for some quick winks.

Reviews.Title: “Problem with staffs”
Reviews.Author: siisuai
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there a couple of times but this time I had quite bad experience with the front. I made a reservation directly by dropping their hotel, and they gave me a confirmation card said "You are booking is now confirmed. Please show this card when you check in" So, I showed the card to front desk when I check in, but the lady made a strange face and said "I cannot find your name" Obviously, I won't have the confirmation card if I didn't make a prior booking! I told them "as you can see on the card, your staff confirmed my booking a few days ago and she gave me the card" but the girls was still making funny face and said "ok ok, then I will write your name down on my booking note. " No apology? the room is clean and good for the value but... they should do something about their staffs.

Reviews.Title: “a bed and a swimming pool, perfect”
Reviews.Author: eileenquick
Reviews.Content: Chose to break the long journey between Auckland and Heathrow with a 12 hour break in SIngapore and found the Terminal 1 Ambassador transit hotel wonderful. Price includes the gorgeous pool and gardens, which is right next to the rooms. Alovely way to relax between flights, slept for 9 hours, swam the rest of the time. Would really reccomend it! Am about to rebook for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Definately needed it”
Reviews.Author: squidmuffin
Reviews.Content: We were in transit from Perth to Vietnam and had 8 hours between flights so having a base and somewhere to rest was really a necessity. The hotel is just perfect for that. We stayed in the terminal 1 hotel which is undergoing rennovations however, we didnt hear anything. It was strange being in a room with No window but it suited our purpose which was to get some sleep. The bathroom was clean and fine just old. But they are rennovating so I assume that will all be modernised soon. One thing to be aware of: if you are flying Jetstar then they tell all passengers in transit to clear immigration and collect baggage then you have to check in again. However, if you are booked into the Transit Hotel you do not go through immigration. What happens is you go to your hotel and when you discharge and no longer need the room you clear immigration and collect your baggage from Lost and found. We actually didnt feel comfortable in leaving our bags to end up at Lost and found especially these days where we are told never to leave baggage unaccompanied - but we asked the immigration officers and they said people who use the transit hotel must do this. it happens everyday. Despite this - our bags were waiting for us at lost and found and all was OK - we had a great rest and it was definitely worth doing.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice”
Reviews.Author: farfaraway99
Reviews.Content: Very good value for money if you do have a somewhat longer stopover at Singapore Airport and want to get some rest...

Reviews.Title: “Ambassador Transit Hotel Terminal 3”
Reviews.Author: djonce
Reviews.Content: We arrived at SIN [Singapore Airport just after 8PM local time and didn’t have a flight out till 6:40 the next morning. Clearing immigration, collecting bags, passing through customs, taxi to hotel, check-in / checkout, taxi back to airport, breakfast, flight & bag check-in, immigration again would have taken 2+ hours time better spent working or resting. The Ambassador Transit Hotel provided a comfortable, exceptionally clean, and reasonably priced alternative. An added bonus was to have a room that faced the tarmac and when we awoke, we could see our plane parked at its gate. We reserved ahead of time by filling out the on-line form. When we arrived, we were greeted warmly and quickly completed the check-in process. We asked for an early wakeup call and received not only the call, but also an extra ‘double check’ 15 minutes later. About the only thing one has to remember to do is pack a change of clothes and toiletries kit for use in the transit zone, because your checked luggage stays down in the baggage handling section of the airport. Before arrival, we had a bit of apprehension about navigating the airport – immigration, different terminals, and baggage claim & recheck between different carriers. But the people at Changi Airport have thought this all through. We arrived in Terminal 1 yet made our hotel reservation in Terminal 3. Upon arrival we simply caught the sky train between terminals. This can be done w/o passing through immigration. In the center of each terminal there are “transit” desks where passengers switching airlines can get the boarding passes of their continuing flights [and much to our delight they had a printout showing that our bags [identified by ID number] were waiting for transfer pending issuance of our boarding passes]. The Ambassador Transit Hotel is located just above the transit desks on the mezzanine level. In this same transit zone are shops and eateries in equivalent number to a good-sized US shopping mall. There is even a movie theatre. The whole experience was very pleasant and left us with a feeling far different than that experienced by movie star Tom Hanks in the recent film called Terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Handy and helpful”
Reviews.Author: criticaleyes7
Reviews.Content: While not a typical Asian hotel with all the trimmings, The ambassador was a great choice for a long layover, especially as my wife got a bug on the plane and a good bed was well appreciated. The staff were very helpful during our short stay and are to be commended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly convenient”
Reviews.Author: Travelby2
Reviews.Content: We landed in Singapore at 2 am, and our next flight didn't leave until 9 am. This IN-airport hotel (no checking out/no immigration/no re-checking in) was so convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at Ambassador about 20 times”
Reviews.Author: orourkeej
Reviews.Content: I commute from the USA to Indonesia half dozen times a year and always arrive late at night in SIN and depart early AM. The convenience factor is therefore primary if I am to get any sleep. The hotel does well on that count. As others have noted, the Terminal 3 hotel is nicer than the Terminal one and two versions but all are acceptable for a place to shower and rest. The rooms are always clean and fine for sleeping. The staff are OK but you really don't interact with them other than checking in. No room service but there are places to eat 24hrs a day within a few minutes walk in the terminal. The major problem with this hotel is getting a confirmed reservation. They are at least ten years behind the times with their reservation system and it is a hassle. I use their on line booking system first but if there is no reply within 48 hours I just call and almost always get a room if I book more than a couple of weeks in advance. There is usually a sorry crowd of walk in (no confirmed reservation) travellers hoping to get a room waiting miserably at the reservation desk. Don't let it happen to you. One trick if they are full is to simply use the rest lounge and shower facility just adjacent to the the Terminal 3 hotel. You can pay by the hour for a nap and take a shower if they don't have a hotel room. Bottom line, if you have a long layover it is nice to be able to take shower/nap and this hotel works just fine for that purpose. Just confirm the reservation as far in advance as you can as they usually fill up and many walk ups end up being turned away.

Reviews.Title: “Ambassador Transit Hotel Terminal 3”
Reviews.Author: SF-Coast-Traveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Ambassador Hotel in Terminal 3. Check in was quick and efficient with helpful staff. The air-conditioned room was small (although not really much smaller than the typical room found in downtown hotels in most major Asian cities) and did not have any windows. The furnishings were modern, the bed comfortable, the linens clean and crisp, and the bathroom spotless with the exception of a bit of mildew on the molding around the shower stall. The room had a large flat screen television mounted on the wall. For about US$46 for six hours I think this is money well spent to be able to have several hours of sleep and a shower in a comfortable and quiet environment for those who have a long transit time.

Reviews.Title: “Suficient Place for a Few Hours”
Reviews.Author: MichWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: I've now stayed twice at the Ambassador Transit Hotel...The first time was in an 'old' terminal, and most recently in T3 (the new terminal). While the place is night-and-day comparing the old and the new, both were sufficient places to get a rest and a shower for a six- or seven-hour layover. The T3 place is indeed brand new, and while it isn't fancy, it's pretty comfortable, although the bed is hard, and the bathroom/shower is pretty basic. From what I understand, unless you're REALLY on a budget, book a room with a private bathroom...They offer two types of rooms--a standard hotel-style room, and an economy room with a shared shower/bathroom. Check in was rather efficient, although I regret giving them my flight info because they said that United requires you to check out at an ungodly amount of time before the flight. No big deal, as I just made my way over to the Singapore Airlines Silver Kris (Business Class) lounge, which is very nice...Among the nicest lounges I've been in--and I've been in a lot around the world. I'd compare the place overall to a Fairfield Inn or Hampton Inn in the USA, not fancy, limited amenities, but comfortable and sufficient for a short rest. Contrary to the reports I read here, I had no problem booking online--submitting my info and being contacted a day or two later. I will concede the first time I stayed there about 2 years ago, it was a much more cumbersome process that took 2-3 e-mails and prodding to book...But my most recent booking was quick and efficient! I'll be transiting in Singapore again in April and am looking forward to another visit at the Ambassador.

Reviews.Title: “A review of the online booking process”
Reviews.Author: MarmaladeT
Reviews.Content: I haven't actually stayed at this hotel yet (so please disregard the date of stay shown in the review, but I had to include a date for the review to be accepted), but my sister and I will be flying from Sydney to London via Singapore in September 2009. Immediately we had booked our flights with Singapore Airlines, I requested a 9 hour reservation at the Ambassador Transit Hotel. Less than 24 hours later, I received an email confirming our reservation and stipulating we must present the email upon checking in. I don't know if the speedy response was due to the length of time between booking and the date reserved but, unlike many other reviewers on the booking process, I'm impressed so far. I'm sure the hotel will be great - the ability to have a shower and a sleep in between flights will make the very long flight to London comparatively easy!

Reviews.Title: “Rent rooms by the hour... without feeling dirty and naughty!”
Reviews.Author: kkua
Reviews.Content: Connecting flight at 0600h, arrival was 1300h the day prior. Hence, I checked in for a room to begin at 2200h...so I lounged by poolside on premises. Nothing special about the premises except they promise you a quiet room. Contruction may be done by the time I write this review (gave full disclaimer upon check-in for potential noise). Book ahead of time...you don't want to be stuck in a room where you have to go to the gym to use their facilities. It's one of the few places in the world where I won't feel guilty sleeping in a property that charges by the hour!

Reviews.Title: “Better than the holiday!”
Reviews.Author: aussieboy7
Reviews.Content: We were absolutely exhausted, I was still suffering from food poisoning from Thailand and we had a 12 hour wait ahead of us until our next flight continuing our journey... The Transit Hotel at Changi Airport was an excellent decision. We paid about Aus$80 for 7 hours and it was definitely money well spent. For any weary travellers, we definitely recommend this. We thought the 7 hours hours spent here was better than the 7 days we had just spent in Thailand. The bed was the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in, the pillows the same, and they make sure the rooms serve their purpose as they are pitch black, quiet, cool - pretty much everything you want in a transit hotel. For those not so exhausted you have free access to the pool and gym and they have tea/coffee making facilities and tv, and the bathroom facilities were really nice also. Gave us the energy to continue on our holiday... Recommend to anyone with a wait ahead of them!

Reviews.Title: “If you get a room”
Reviews.Author: almndxeyez
Reviews.Content: Take home message: BE SURE YOU HAVE A CONFIRMATION LETTER!!!! Prior to arrival, I had sent multiple online bookings via the Changi airport website. First time was 2 months in advance. After not hearing anything, I tried again 6 weeks prior to arrival. When I did not receive anything again, I tried 3 weeks later. Of note, there is no e-mail contacts of whom you can get touch w/ at hand on the website. Maybe we should've called... We landed @ 23:00. After 3 attempts, maybe they'll have something on file. There wasn't. And because there were no more rooms and we didn't have the confirmation letter they wanted, we were turned away. They said come back in an hour, there "may be rooms left". Naturally I was upset as we would hav to fly out in only 8 more hours. Even worse, the manager stated that they get these complaints all the time. They get "hundreds, thousands, everyday. If you have letter, I give you room. I'm just trying to do my job." .........so after so many complaints, why hasn't Ambassador Transit improved their booking protocol??????? Anyways, we did return @ 12:30. And "magically", there were not one, but 2 rooms available. We checked in and would hopefully have a good night. As for the room itself, it wasn't the quietest. We couldn't sleep w/out earplugs d/t construction. The room isn't luxurious, but efficient. The bathroom didn't smell too clean, but we kept the door closed. We slept well enough. On the upside, we didn't have to go to through customs to find a hotel room. If things go as planned, you can save a lot of time and gain lots of sleep. Of note, we learned later that if have some time, there are hotels in Singapore outside the airport that also charge by hour blocks, like the Royal Crowne Plaza. And you get a much nicer place to stay. If and when in transit via Singapore, we may go for this option next time.

Reviews.Title: “Plastic mugs, Ambassador?”
Reviews.Author: Bicholisto
Reviews.Content: Great idea to break the flight by using a hotel embedded within the airport. However, don´t be fooled by the website: luxury this ain´t. On arrival at the Terminal 2 branch (the one with no swimming pool or bar) we were mistakenly given an unserviced (i.e. dirty) room: not a good start. The next room was better: serviced, clean and larger, but so much could be improved. For your money you get uncontrollably cold a/c, not enough blankets or pillows (ask for more), plastic mugs, an old grubby and defective kettle (I still have the steam burn), nowhere to hang clothes, and enough mechanical humming to inhibit a good sleep without earplugs. The ATH is not especially expensive, but we paid more here than in most of the Australian motels we had been staying in, and the quality is simply much poorer. Time for a complete refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Just the ticket !!”
Reviews.Author: MikeW49
Reviews.Content: I don’t quite know what people expect from a transit hotel, views, room service, may be a restaurant, well if you do, don’t go there. However if you just want to check in (speedy and efficient staff but not offering a welcome drink!!) and then have the use of a clean room with bath and shower facilities this is a great hotel. In transit I had a good sleep in a comfortable bed, a lovely hot bath, change of clothing and was refreshed and ready for the next part of the journey. What more do you want ?

Reviews.Title: “Please Don't Give Them Your Business !!!!”
Reviews.Author: ANGRYCUSTOMER_8
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed there overnight in between flight,staff were rude and th room was below standard. the hotel is handy because you dont have to pass through immigration as it is inside the airport. however the hotel knows this , and has raised its prices to a more unrealistic level this year, and has the mafia like attitude of "where else are you going to go". just this week i tried to book a room there for convienence sake, as our next flight was the following day. however they didnt even bother to reply and confirm our booking.they are a total joke.i will never stay there again, and hope to let as many people now of how bad they are there and for people to please reconsider staying there. there is another option. i have recently found out that there is another very professional REAL hotel that has opened with access through terminal 3,it is caled th CROWNE PLAZA HOTEL, it is not affiliated with thetransit hotel and although a little more expensive, they have definately got mybusiness from now on !! BE WARNED STAY AWAY FROM THE TRANSIT HOTEL!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service for a affordable price”
Reviews.Author: arampama
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during transit while travelling from London to Sydney. Extremly happy about the service provided by hotel reception staff. Rooms were very clean and well maintained. We booked a triple share room as my 9 year old son travelled with us. Very reasonable pricing.I have already recommended this hotel to many of my friends. Staying at ambassador hotel has been a very pleasant experience. Thank you very much for your excellent service Ambassador staff.

Reviews.Title: “Go for it!”
Reviews.Author: HoutBayDiver
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at the Terminal 2 outlet of this hotel and highly recommend this wonderful way to catch up on lost sleep while in transit, to everyone. I am glad that I chose this option, rather than trying to cram in some Singapore sightseeing – even though I have never visited this city before. Herewith my notes which I hope will be useful to others planning to book here: 1.Persevere with the booking, accept they are slow and send a second mail 24 hours after the first, or phone the number on the hotel website, it is worth it! 2.Booking is confirmed by email and no deposit is required, a printout of the confirmation needs to be shown on arrival 3.The hotel has two outlets, at Terminal 2 and Terminal 3, the latter has been completed in 2008 and is apparently newer. We stayed in the older Terminal 2 and it was more than adequate. 4.Do not expect modern chic, in contrast with the rest of the airport, the hotel rooms reflect the 70’s comfort, it’s the décor that is dated, not the appliances, beds or linen. (see my photos) 5.Pack all you need in your hand luggage as you will be unable to collect your checked in luggage. 6.Your checked in luggage will automatically be stored while you are in transit, and when checking in for your onward flight, it will be forwarded to that flight. See point 9. 7.Do not clear immigration, take the Sky Train to your appointed Terminal and follow the clear signposts to the hotel on the first floor. 8.Do not delay to book in, whilst the hotel allows for delays they are not bound to wait longer than reasonable before giving your room to someone else. Remember you pay no deposit, so many people don’t turn up, whilst lots of people without bookings also come to ask for rooms. Leave shopping and eating for after you have booked in. 9.You can get your boarding ticket and arrange onward luggage for your ongoing flight at a Transfer Desk close to the Hotel (ask at reception), no matter how many hours you are spending in transit, prior to tucking into bed. I highly recommend doing this. It means you can sleep in longer and don’t have any rush on waking up. You will just have to check which Gate you will be boarding, as this only gets allocated an hour or two prior to take off. 10.We booked and on arrival paid for a double room but were allocate a triple room. Here we found a comfortable double bed as well as a single bed in a spacious bedroom. Mattresses and pillows (one each) were good and linen was clean and crisp. There were two bedside tables with big reading lamps, a telephone as well as two tub chairs.(see room photo). The dressing table with mirror, housed a large TV.on top and a kettle with tea, coffee, sugar and milk powder sachets. We found a hair dryer in the drawer. (See dressing table photo) The information brochure informed you that you could, if needed, request a toothbrush and paste, as well as a sewing kit, from reception, depending on availability. There were hooks to hang your clothes and ample space floor space for your hand luggage. The room had no window, but this did not bother us as the air conditioner worked very well. 11.The bathroom mirror spanned the width of the basin vanity and there was a shaver plug. We had a bath (bliss!) and a shower over the bath. (see bathroom photo) The showerhead gave a good strong jet and water was sufficiently hot. The bathroom was equipped with hotel style soap, shampoo and shower cap and there was a standard size face and hand towel for each person. 12.We received two wake up calls from reception, allowing for 30 minutes to clear the room (you can request a wake up call at your chosen time) 13.There are lots of 24 hour cafes, coffees shops, restaurants and shops nearby. On checking out we determined our boarding gate, then enjoyed a leisurely breakfast nearby, relaxed and ready to face the next leg of our journey Way to go!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the somnolent traveler”
Reviews.Author: surlaw888
Reviews.Content: A decently priced (S$55 for each 6 hour block + tax), clean and comfortable hotel. My husband and I stayed in the hotel in Terminal 3. Our room had twin beds, large ensuite shower and a flat screen TV. There were no windows - but this may be of benefit to those who want to have a quiet sleep in complete darkness. There's free wireless internet, a good range of shops, free movies in the adjacent movie theatre and a range of food options a hop/skip/jump away from the hotel in the terminal to keep the restless traveler happily occupied. Our only gripe with this place was the reservation process. They have an internet booking link on the website, but the hotel provided us with NO confirmation - we called up from Sydney to check - and they rebooked us in! This is not up to the usual standards expected in super-efficient Singapore. Another option for those transiting for longer periods would be to take a ''Singapore Stopover'' (I think this can be booked through the Singapore Airlines website) as this may prove more cost efficient if you need to stay in Singapore for more than 12+ hours.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for overnight transit”
Reviews.Author: fitzrovians
Reviews.Content: A stock standard and well priced hotel (priced in 6 hour blocks) if strictly in transit for more than a few hours at Singapore. The room is spacious, clean and very quiet with no natural lighting and large bed and flat-screen TV. The hotel is within the transit area so no need to clear customs and immigration. If by chance you are picking up luggage at Singapore en-route you will need to clear immigration, pick up your bags and then check-in early for your onward flight (if possible) and return back through the passport control to the Transit Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless and fitted the bill”
Reviews.Author: Victorianlad
Reviews.Content: The booking process was a pain. I had to call the hotel from Australia long distance whebn I failed to receive a reply to two emails. I booked the hotel for 0100 to 0700 (the usual six hour block) but upon arrival at reception at 0025, I was informed I could have the room from 0030 to 0630 which I accepted. Others who had not reserved in advance were not so lucky, with other rooms becoming available at 0200. The rate of S$55 or so for an ensuite room was fine, although in fairness Fragrance hotels 25 minutes away by MRT metro train and a 7 minute walk are the same price for 24 hours, not just 6. Ambassador Transit's room was spotless. Even the bathroom had been properly cleaned, and the bed linen was immaculate. But the best feature was despite it being a transit hotel with passengers coming and going all night, there was no noise whatsover. Yes, the hotel is windowless, but let's face it, most users just want to sleep between flights in cattle class. This hotel is well designed and is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Terminal 3 - Brand New”
Reviews.Author: TravellingCarlito
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the Transit Hotel in terminal 3. I had read the reviews about the other Transit Hotels in Changi and hadn't kept any high expectations before checking into this one. Being a relatively new terminal, the state of the hotel was in perfect working order. The reception is modest, with only a small desk and a couple of tables and chairs. The check-in process was basic but efficient. The reception are very helpful, willing to attend to any request I had. The room I was given was a twin room, so it was big enough for a single person. You will find a plasma TV in the room, with basic cable channels. The beds are a lot more comfortable than they appear. The pillows are nice and plush. The bathroom is also quite spacious. Modern and clean, just like the rest of the room and the hotel. My room also had a view of the runway, which was great. I had no issues with noise, thanks to the double glazed windows of the hotel and the terminal. No breakfast is served here, as there are plenty of options outside the hotel to eat. Wake-up service is available if you need. There is also internet available within the hotel, where you can connect to their wireless internet from the room or use the PCs at reception. However, there is a fee. But since Changi airport has free wi-fi and PCs to use, why pay for it? That being said, the free wi-fi can't be accessed from the rooms, so you will need to leave your room to access it. Overall, if you need a hotel whilst transitting in Changi, I highly recommend this hotel in Terminal 3. You can even leave the terminal to go to the city if you really want to do a spot of shopping or eating before you catch up on sleep at the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Long Haul Relief”
Reviews.Author: Please_upgrade
Reviews.Content: We had a 7-hr transit stop enroute from Melbourne to London on Singapore Airlines. I booked a 6-hr block at the Terminal 3 Transit Hotel which had opened just a week before. Needless to say, the service and accommodation was immaculate, this is Singapore after all. Changi Terminal 3 is a long building. The hotel is at the far end, away from the long-haul concourse. After a sleep, shower and coffee in the room, we were better prepared to face the 13 hour flight home to London. My only slight concern is that whilst the room request can be lodged via the hotel website, you really do need to follow-up for a confirmation. We paid about SGD55 for the 6-hour block - a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “I rate this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tapas1NZ
Reviews.Content: Flying for almost 24 hours from N.Z. to London isnt my idea of fun so I was pleased to see I had a 14 hour stopover after one of the legs, in Singapore. I knew sleep would be a necessity but after searching for the transit hotel on trip advisor all I read were bad reviews?! Personally I found the transit hotel in Singapore airport to be absolutely perfect, from the service through to the flexibility in booking a certain number of hours (i booked two 6 hour blocks). Cheap, easy and an invaluable decision!

Reviews.Title: “What a life saver”
Reviews.Author: travellingduo88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were travelling from Perth to Koh Samui and had an 8 hour stopover in Singapore. As I didn't fancy leaving the airport and going through customs and immigration etc I booked a 6 hour block in this hotel. I have to say it was one of my better decisions. There was a quick, no fuss check in and we went immediately to our spacious, spotless room where we were able to take a deep bath, make a cup of tea and then I had a wonderful uninterrupted sleep while my husband watched TV. It was just simply a very relaxing and inexpensive way to pass the time and to be refreshed for the next flight. I will definitely be taking advantage of this facility again as we found it a most pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job!”
Reviews.Author: theexpl0rers
Reviews.Content: The transit hotel was just what we needed. We had flown in from Langkawi at 10pm and just needed to sleep as we were flying out to Heathrow the next day. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Once they saw that we were a party of 2 adults and 2 very sleepy children they upgraded our room to a larger one. There was a king size bed, single bed and they also supplied a cot. The room was very dated but comfortable. You could just pop out and get anything you need from the shops in the airport. When we arrived at the airport we went straight to the transfer desk. They checked us in for our onging flight to Heathrow with Singapore airlines, gave us our boarding passes for the next day and they organised someone to collect our luggage, retag it and get it on to the correct connecting plane. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “a gem in little india”
Reviews.Author: kagra
Reviews.Content: the ambassador hotel is located in a quiet street along desker road in little india. as soon as you turn the corner, you will find yourself immersed in indian culture ala singapore. mustafa center is just a few meters away, the hawker shops, indian foodshoppes, a wet market are also in the same vicinity but when you are back in desker road, it is quiet as if the excitement and chaos of little india never happened. the train station farrer park is about 2 blocks away, which is pretty amazing since singapore is cheaply accesible through the railways. a few more blocks away is queen street where the bus station to all of singapore and malaysia is located. sim lim square is also a few blocks away by foot should the urge to splurge on electronics bite you. decor is minimal, the bathrooms pretty clean with rainshower heads for that relaxing hot shower. rooms are cleaned daily. and for a triple room for only SGD110/night, this is hotel is quite a find! front desk service is a mix of indian and filipino staff who are really friendly and helpful. the hotel has no in house resto but the hawker shops are a must try for anyone visiting singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GDDSydney
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel by contacting them directly. You can't beat this location for transit convenience - especially between long flights or during extended layover times.

Reviews.Title: “No reply to my two emails”
Reviews.Author: rojo
Reviews.Content: The Ambassador seems like a great idea, but like others they failed to answer my email requests for a reservation. I tried six months ahead and got the automated reply, but no follow up. I tried again three weeks in advance and didn't even get the automated reply. I tried just showing up, but they were fully booked and had no record of my emails. I guess they are so busy they don't have to care about their customer service, but it certainly is disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Rubies
Reviews.Content: Arrived from Denpasar with 3 tired children at around 1.40am. Suffice to say, it was perfect timing. We booked for one block and it couldnt have been easier. We booked over the net, and cannot recall if it took long. We booked a couple of months in advance. Had adjacent rooms. Whilst the fitout is a little tired, the comfort and convenience outweigh any negatives. The bathroom is well appointed and had all the necessary toiletries except toothpaste. Perhaps this toiletry item should now be included as one cannot take it onboard in hand luggage any more. The next morning, the children watched a plane being taxied out from our bedroom window....they thought that was great! We collected our luggage later after going through immigration and then spent our time in Singapore until our next flight. Book in advance if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you can get a booking”
Reviews.Author: jaminicacricket
Reviews.Content: I too had problems booking this hotel. I booked through their website about a month and a half in advance and got the message about having to wait 7 days. I waited about 10 days with no response, and then emailed them back requesting that they contact me. About 2 weeks after the original booking request was sent they finally got back to me with a confirmed room. So the message here is, if you don't have more than 2 weeks before you need to stay there, its probably not a good idea to try and book it! The actual hotel itself was fine. I stayed in the Terminal one complex. It was very clean and tidy, and had all you need for a rest/recoup between flights.
