It had tea/coffee making facilities, TV, clean bathroom and fairly comfortable bed. My room had a window which looked directly out onto the runway - despite the coming and goings of planes all night I couldn't really hear much noise at all. Something I wasnt aware of before booking is that you can't clear customs and pick up your bags before staying at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Don't recommend to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: FlyingKiwi44
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here overnight on the way from New Zealand to London, and it was an awful, sleepless night that made the flights worse rather than easier. We'd we're given a double rather than the twin room we had booked, and had to wait for a twin to become available. When we did get a room it was so noisy, with people constantly hauling luggage up and down the corridors, and completely inadequate sound-proofing so that every wake-up call in the surrounding rooms was audible. I couldn't sleep at all, and we actually ended up checking out early, and just sitting in the airport til our next flight. On the way back from London we stayed instead at one of the Singapore Stopover hotels, and although the price was similar, the experience was vastly different. I totally recommend doing a Stopover deal instead of the Transit. It's really no problem at all getting in and out of the airport, this is Changi, not Heathrow, and you'll have a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Gives Singapore a bad name”
Reviews.Author: Bunehop
Reviews.Content: Like others who have had booking issues I used the web site and received an auto reply that confirmation would be advised in 7days. Three weeks later I was still waiting so I sent an email asking for news but received no reply. This is very disappointing for an airport and city state that promotes itself as world class and tourist friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Oregonzied
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to rest your head after a long long flight (17+ hours). However you MUST book at least three or four weeks or longer in advance via their website. Confirmations take far longer than the seven days mentioned on their website. Room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Total Rubbish!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Perjan
Reviews.Content: I have been trying to book this hotel for 2 weeks and nobody ever gets back to me! What is the problem???? Do they not know what customer service is??? I am so disgucted that I am tempted to write to the manager, but I am sure that even they wouldn't write back! I cannot believe that in a place like Singapore, that generally has great customer service, this ridiculous excuse for a hotel cannot even be bothered to write back to say if they have rooms or not. Well ,they can put their rooms where the sun doesn't shine!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a kip and a shower”
Reviews.Author: michael1032
Reviews.Content: We stayed here en route from Sydney to London. We took the room for 9 hours and had a good 7 hours sleep and a shower. Just what is required to set you up for the horrible 13.5 hour flight to LHR. The room was perfectly ok with a comfortable bed and good bathroom. No noise whatsoever. We timed our flights so that we would arrive at Singapore when our body clocks thought it was bed time thereby helping to get a good sleep and booked the hotel as soon as we had booked the flights.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable and inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: Melnq8
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Ambassador Transit Hotel in Changi Airport many times as we live in Indonesia, and travel through Singapore frequently. Our most recent stay was our best to date. We spent 10 hours in a double room in Terminal 2 between flights (S$120 net). Our room was spacious and appeared to have been recently refurbished. Unlike rooms we've had here in the past which have been windowless, this one had a large window which faced a tall exterior wall. We could hear some traffic noise, but it was muffled and distant. The room was basic, but clean and comfortable. The king sized bed was a bit hard, but suited us fine. The bathroom was small, but clean and perfectly adequate. This hotel is extremely busy - we book as soon as our travel plans are finalized and usually have no problem getting a room. The hotel will often send an automated e-mail response to reservation requests, advising they will get back to you within seven days, so last minute bookings could be problematic. Having said that, I've been able to get a room on a walk-in basis as well, so you just never know. Caveat - Like many hotels in Singapore, the Ambassador Transit Hotel has a nasty habit of charging your credit card in the currency of your home country without asking your permission (dynamic currency conversion). I've solved this problem by telling them up front that I want my credit card to be charged in Singapore dollars, and they're always happy to oblige.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfactory!”
Reviews.Author: MilesDependent
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in the Terminal One side of the hotel on a stopover between Sydney and London. Positive: * Room. While the room is a little antiquated, it was perfectly satisfactory, with a comfortable bed, television with basic cable, good bathroom with a bath and basic toiletries. In all, far from spectacular but extremely pleasant. * Service. The service at the front desk was smooth, efficient and friendly - typical Singapore. * Airport. Changi airport is a great place to wander around. You can leave the bags in your room, and check out all the shops and eateries without having to lug your cabin bag around. *Peace & Quiet. As another reviewed mentioned, the hotel's website warns of noise from construction. I did not hear a peep from construction while there. Negative: Nothing! Overall: I was very pleased with the hotel. It's great to break up a long flight without having to worry about getting a taxi to a downtown hotel. I will stay here again, and would highly recommend the hotel to others! It's really just a place to rest for a few hours - and it does that job perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Service! Unreliable”
Reviews.Author: TravelMomLA
Reviews.Content: This hotel confirmed our reservation and then changed it to put us on a wait list. It is no fun being stuck at 2am in Singapore expecting to have a reserved room and finding out they don't have availability. The service (or lack of such) is a joke! They are extremely insensative and plain rude. They are unresponsive and I would never stay there again or allow my friends to go there. It is just NOT worth the few dollars you would save because you will not be assured of your reservation.
